required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicentric Clinical Study on Trifocal Intraocular Lens Isatis TF
clinical_study.official_title: Multicentric Clinical Study to Determine Safety and Efficacy of a Hydrophobic Acrylic Trifocal Intraocular Lens (IOL)

brief_summary.textblock: The study will be a multicentric, prospective open-label ethics committee approved clinical study to investigate safety, visual outcomes, contrast sensitivity and rotational stability after bilateral implantation of Isatis TF IOL following cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicentric, prospective, open-label clinical study whereby patients undergoing routine cataract surgery will have bilateral implantation of hydrophobic acrylic refractive trifocal intraocular lenses (Isatis TF).
The investigational device and all study products, including the devices used for the study examinations, will be used within the intended use specifications from the manufacturer. In addition, no invasive or other burdening examinations will occur for the patient.
The study will be carried out in up to five clinical centers in Spain.
The device under investigation is a hydrophobic acrylic trifocal intraocular lens (IOL) manufactured by the sponsor of this study. The trifocality of this investigational device is based on a purely refractive principle with the goal to provide additional near and intermediate visual acuity with low photic side effects. The IOLs will be implanted in the course of routine cataract surgery and will benefit to patients suffering from cataract development.
In total 120 patients will be recruited for this clinical study and undergo bilateral implantation of the Isatis TF intraocular lens. Subjects participating in the trial will attend a total of maximum 10 study visits over a period of 4-6 months. Subjects would have the option for unscheduled visits if required medically.
Final data analyses will be performed after the last patient finished the final postoperative examination (120-180 days after surgery of second eye).

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Safety Endpoint: Rates of Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: The objective is to compare the SPE (Safety and Performance Endpoints) rates of the investigational product to reference data stated in the according ISO norm for posterior intraocular lenses (EN ISO 11979-7:2018) based on minimum 100 subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Performance Endpoint: Uncorrected Near Visual Acuity
primary_outcome.description: The primary performance endpoint is to show statistically significant superior near visual acuity outcomes on Isatis TF compared to outcomes obtained in a clinical study on a monofocal control lens. The control lens shares main IOL properties as lens raw material and is considered equivalent to the monofocal version of the device under investigation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint: Best Corrected Distance Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: The objective is to compare best corrected distance visual acuities (CDVA) above defined thresholds of the investigational product to the normative data stated in the acccording ISO norm (EN ISO 11979-7:2018) for posterior chamber intraocular lenses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Performance Endpoint: Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA)
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary performance endpoint is to show a statistically significant increase between pre-and postoperative findings on monocular Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) under photopic light conditions on the first implanted eye.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Performance Endpoint: Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA)
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary performance endpoint is to show a statistically significant increase between pre-and postoperative findings on monocular Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA) under photopic light conditions on the first implanted eye.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (UDVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 1-2 days postoperative; 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular UDVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 4m distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (UDVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular UDVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 4m distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Corrected Distance Visual Acuity (CDVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular CDVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 4m distance with best aided corrective glasses according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Corrected Distance Visual Acuity (CDVA) under mesopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular CDVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 4m distance with best aided corrective glasses according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under mesopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Corrected Distance Visual Acuity (CDVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular CDVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 4m distance with best aided corrective glasses according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Uncorrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (UIVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular UIVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 66cm distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Uncorrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (UIVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular UIVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 66cm distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Uncorrected Near Visual Acuity (UNVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular UNVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 40cm distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Uncorrected Near Visual Acuity (UNVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular UNVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 40cm distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular DCIVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 66cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA) under mesopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular DCIVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 66cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under mesopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular DCIVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 66cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Monocular Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: Monocular DCNVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 40cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done monocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) under mesopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular DCNVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 40cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under mesopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Binocular DCNVA is measured with ETDRS charts placed in 40cm distance with corrective glasses for far distance according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This assessment is done binocularly under photopic light conditions.

other_outcome.measure: Manifest refraction
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The manifest refraction is measured by means of a phoropter. The data contains values for sphere, cylinder and axis of cylinder according to ISO 11979-7:2018. This data will also be used to calculate the manifest refractive spherical equivalent (MRSE)

other_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Refractive Spherical Equivalent (MRSE)
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The predictability of the postoperative manifest refraction will be evaluated using the absolute value of the adjusted MRSE calculated by the following formula: MRSEadjusted = MRSEpostop - MRSEtarget.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Defocus Curve
other_outcome.description: To assess the visual acuity for different distances, defocus curves under photopic light conditions are measured. This test is performed with best distance corrected refraction and spherical additions ranging from -4.5 D to +2.0 D in 0.5 D steps. This examination is performed binocularly.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Contrast Sensitivity under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Contrast Sensitivity under photopic light conditions using the standardized contrast sensitivity device CSV-1000 (VectorVision). This examination is performed binocularly.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Contrast Sensitivity under mesopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Contrast Sensitivity under mesopic light conditions using the standardized contrast sensitivity device CSV-1000 (VectorVision). This examination is performed binocularly.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Contrast Sensitivity under photopic light conditions and using a glare source
other_outcome.description: Contrast Sensitivity under photopic light conditions with a glare source using the standardized contrast sensitivity device CSV-1000 (VectorVision). This examination is performed binocularly.

other_outcome.measure: Binocular Contrast Sensitivity under mesopic light conditions and using a glare source
other_outcome.description: Contrast Sensitivity under mesopic light conditions with a glare source using the standardized contrast sensitivity device CSV-1000 (VectorVision). This examination is performed binocularly.

other_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcomes - Quality of Vision questionnaire [McAlinden et al, 2010]
other_outcome.description: To assess the subjective perception of disturbances by photic phenomena, the validated and verified Quality of Vision (QoV) questionnaire will be used. This questionnaire is a linear-scaled 30-item instrument and is designed with 10 symptoms rated in each of three scales (frequency, severity, and bothersome). The QoV Questionnaire provides a QoV score in terms of symptom frequency, severity, and bothersome [McAlinden et al, 2010].

other_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcomes - Catquest-9SF 2011 questionnaire [Lundström et al, 2009]
other_outcome.description: To assess if difficulties in daily life occur due to impaired sight. This questionnaire is a 9-item Rasch-scaled instrument to assess subjective perception of visual impairment after surgery [Lundström et al, 2009].

other_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcomes - Patient-Reported Spectacle Independence Questionnaire (PRSIQ) [Morlock et al, 2017]
other_outcome.description: The PRSIQ is a patient-reported measure assessing spectacle independence following cataract surgery. The analyses conducted provide evidence for the use of the PRSIQ total score as a measure of spectacle independence [Morlock et al, 2017].

other_outcome.measure: Pupil Size under photopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Photopic pupil diameters are measured with a ruler allowing for a precision of at least +/-0.5 mm. In addition to the measurement with a ruler, pupil diameters under photopic light conditions will be recorded from the preoperative Pentacam measurement. For the photopic pupil diameters, eye illumination should be identical to that used for photopic contrast sensitivity testing. Pupil measurements should only be made after the eye has had time to fully adapt to the testing conditions (at least 5 minutes). The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Pupil Size under mesopic light conditions
other_outcome.description: Mesopic pupil diameters are measured with a ruler allowing for a precision of at least +/-0.5 mm. For the mesopic pupil diameters, eye illumination should be identical to that used for mesopic contrast sensitivity testing. Pupil measurements should only be made after the eye has had time to fully adapt to the testing conditions (at least 5 minutes). The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Fundus examination with dilated pupil
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: • Fundus

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - Corneal status
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 1-2 days postoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: • Corneal Status

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - Signs of inflammation
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 1-2 days postoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: Signs of inflammation Anterior chamber cells, Anterior chamber flare, Cystoid macular oedema, Hypopyon, and Endophthalmitis.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - Pupillary block
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - Pupillary block.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - Retinal detachment
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - Retinal detachment.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - Status of anterior and posterior capsule
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - Status of anterior and posterior capsule.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - IOL decentration
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - IOL decentration.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - IOL tilt
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - IOL tilt.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - IOL discoloration
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - IOL discoloration.

other_outcome.measure: Slitlamp examination - IOL opacity
other_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The slitlamp examination is one examination to analyse the integrity of eye structures and the implanted IOL. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018. With the slitlamp the ophthalmologist can observe the eyes stereoscopically. A focussed slit of light, which can be width-adjusted, is projected on the eye to be examined. The investigator observes this projection on the eye through a reflected light microscope. The slitlamp is used to observe the anterior and posterior part of the eye, including cornea, lens and anterior chamber. By dilating the pupil the fundus can also be examined. Following conditions shall be examined with the slitlamp: - IOL opacity.

other_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure (IOP) measurement
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, 1-2 days postoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: The IOP will be measured with non-contact tonometer as part of the routine follow up examinations. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Keratometry
other_outcome.description: Keratometric measurements are performed to calculate the required IOL power. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: IOL power and target refraction
other_outcome.description: The parameter of the implanted IOL must be recorded as well as the target refraction given by the IOL calculator. This parameter is needed to calculate the accuracy of achieving the target refraction. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Fundus OCT
other_outcome.description: An OCT (optical coherence tomography) image will be taken at the preoperative visit to identify AMD suspicious eyes that need to be excluded from this study. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Biometry
other_outcome.description: Biometry measurements are performed to calculate the required IOL power. The examination is performed and documented according to the guidelines in ISO 11979-7:2018.

other_outcome.measure: Corneal topography
other_outcome.description: Pentacam device (Oculus, Germany) will be used to perform corneal topography. This examination is needed to exclude patients showing an irregular corneal astigmatism.

other_outcome.measure: Corneal aberrometry
other_outcome.description: Pentacam device (Oculus, Germany) will be used to perform corneal aberrometry measurement. The following values will be evaluated in this study: Spherical aberrations, high order aberrations.

other_outcome.measure: IOL rotation
other_outcome.time_frame: day of surgery, 1-2 days postoperative, 7-14 days postoperative, 30-60 days postoperative, 120-180 days postoperative
other_outcome.description: To determine the rotational stability of the lenses after implantation, the actual IOL orientation has to be recorded as the intended surgical position during surgery using a photograph through the surgery microscope or within one hour after surgery using a photograph through a slit lamp to document the rotational position of the IOL. Additional orientations are measured and recorded at the follow up visits by taking retroilluminated photographs in mydriasis using the slit lamp. To determine the rotational stability, it is important that the IOL axis marks of the IOL are visible as well as concurrent structures of the eye (in the same image) that are fixed and stable. Preferred fixed structures are limbal vessels. The pupil is dilated if necessary to visualize the IOL axis marks.

intervention.description: Patients will be implanted with study IOL in both eyes

reference.citation: McAlinden C, Pesudovs K, Moore JE. The development of an instrument to measure quality of vision: the Quality of Vision (QoV) questionnaire. Invest Ophthalmol Vis Sci. 2010 Nov;51(11):5537-45. doi: 10.1167/iovs.10-5341. Epub 2010 May 26.

Morlock R, Wirth RJ, Tally SR, Garufis C, Heichel CWD. Patient-Reported Spectacle Independence Questionnaire (PRSIQ): Development and Validation. Am J Ophthalmol. 2017 Jun;178:101-114. doi: 10.1016/j.ajo.2017.03.018. Epub 2017 Mar 22.

Lundström M, Pesudovs K. Catquest-9SF patient outcomes questionnaire: nine-item short-form Rasch-scaled revision of the Catquest questionnaire. J Cataract Refract Surg. 2009 Mar;35(3):504-13. doi: 10.1016/j.jcrs.2008.11.038.
